author: Sanjith Sidhardhan
title: I’m done with remakes: Dileep
text:
Dileep was to play the lead in the Malayalam version of Bollywood hit Vicky Donor but it looks like his experience with his last remake, Ivan Maryadaraman, has made him drop the idea altogether.
Ivan Maryadaraman , an adaptation of Telugu film Maryada Ramanna, was a box office dud, and the actor was criticised for taking up such films.
Dileep had purchased the rights of Vicky Donor from Bollywood star John Abraham two years ago but has no plans of going ahead with the project. "I am done with remakes," he says firmly.
While he acknowledges that several Malayalam movies have remake potential in other languages, he concedes the reverse is extremely tough. "Many of our movies get remade in other languages because people there don't hunt down the original version on the internet and watch it," the actor explains. "But Malayalis download every version made, refuse to go to the theatres to watch the remake, and then blast the makers for remaking it."
Dileep also shares that there are great scripts coming out of Mollywood now. "I'd rather spend time listening to original scripts here and do such films instead of wasting my time with remakes." He also says that the multilingual movie Baba Sathya Sai, to be helmed by Kodi Ramakrishna, is "still on." "We made a few changes and the team is now busy with the scripting, which should be done by the end of this year," says the Chandrettan Evideya star, adding that he hopes to begin filming from next year onwards.
Dileep is all set to star in King Liar, Siddique-Lal duo's first movie together after 16 years, which will have Madonna Sebastian playing the female lead.
